channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple large potholes heading down the hill, 5th February
item.description:
Multiple large potholes heading down the hill which are unavoidable and require evasive action which is dangerous. Reported a long time ago and nothing has happened
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Swindon Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple large potholes heading West, 5th February
item.description:
Multiple large potholes heading West, causing drivers to erratically avoid them which is very dangerous. Has been like this for a long time and nothing is being done
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Hesters Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water pipe running onto the lane out of field, 5th February
item.description:
There is a pipe coming out of the field onto the lane. It runs constantly onto the lane, it is causing a considerable amount of damage on the lane. It is running like a river and literally a gulley down the lane causing damage to everyone‚Äôs tyres and vehicles. Surely this is not allowed. The people that have done it live at Yew Tree Farm. Please can this be looked at for them to remove this pipe going directly into the lane as it is ruining Dark Lane. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dark Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Water running 24/7, 5th February
item.description:
For weeks now there has been water constantly running out of the ‚Äòwaste land‚Äô and making a gulley at the edge of the lane, it‚Äôs going quite a way, wearing all the tarmac away right into a ditch at the bottom of Dog Lane. I don‚Äôt know if this is a new spring that has appeared because of where the earth has moved due to the roadworks on the A417 or whether it is a water leak from Severn Trent. But it is flowing extremely quickly and it‚Äôs causing a lot of damage on the lane so if this cousin be looked into and sorted that would be brilliant please. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bentham Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 5th February
item.description:
Hello, I reported this blocked drain with water running constantly down the lane about 8 weeks ago and was told that it was on the routine list to do but nobody has been out to unblock it. Please can it been looked at and stop the water running down the lane 24/7 causing the tarmac to be broken/worn away. Thank you üôèüèª

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bin needs emptying, 5th February
item.description:
We were not happy when this bin was placed here a couple of years ago, we own the field it‚Äôs next to and we have in lamb sheep in there of which dog pooh is extremely toxic to as it causes abortion, we were told it was going to be emptied often so it wouldn‚Äôt be a problem but is so full that the rubbish is coming out and blowing over the field. And there is massive bags of dog pooh that is in there that people have obviously collected from their garden as there is a big one right at the top I can see, it‚Äôs really disgusting. I would like this bin to be emptied and I would really appreciate it if this bin was moved further down whitelands lane towards the main road, there is plenty of room for it down there which would be a much better place. As also I like to keep the verge tidy outside the field with the tractor and topper but it is hard to now there is a big bin right in the middle of the verge. But most of it it‚Äôs not nice at all to be checking the sheep everyday smelling dog pooh and worrying about the sheep. So I would really appreciate this being looked into, thank you üôèüèª

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitelands Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
